page.title: 13WILDLIFE : BIRDS
page.content: Glenprosen has all the common birds as found in Britain.72 have in fact been authentically seen. We have our favourites however. The{Cuckoo }is a summer visitor who comes at the start of May. We see and hear him from the playground.{House Martins}nest under the eves around the school. Their numbers have been decreasing in recent years and this year we have only 3 nests. About 15 years ago there were 57 nests counted. {Short Eared Owls } had a fairly dramatic increase a few years ago owing to planting of trees which increased Vole population on which the owls feed. {Sand Martins no longer breed at Buckhood but still do at Dykhead, 5 miles down the glen. {Green Woodpecker and Great Spotted {Woodpecker }breed but both species took a set back in the severe winter of 1982-83.
